name: The Earthwound
notes: quest rares take 1min to respawn, not a bad idea to wait for them

name: Wanted: The Boroughbreaker
notes: quest rares take 1min to respawn, not a bad idea to wait for them

name: Delver's Call: Kriegval's Rest
ratingJustification: very good monster XP, good speed
notes: as with all delves, these are prime congested XP but can be slightly less efficient than speed questing

name: Delver's Call: Fungal Folly
ratingJustification: annoying delve layouts, bad monster xp gains
notes: as with all delves, these are prime congested XP but can be slightly less efficient than speed questing

name: Hope, An Anomaly
ratingJustification: super efficient questing, right alongside MSQ
notes: HIGHLY recommended to do, it's right alongside MSQ and good XP

name: Seven Soldiers
ratingJustification: pretty short quests, only the final quest has issues with congestion

name: Spores of Dread
ratingJustification: single quest chain which will have extreme issues with congestion

name: Remember Me, Earthen (full)
ratingJustification: this area can be very awkward if congested, but quests are very condensed. I recommend stopping after Who Runs this Fine Establishment? (or whenever you leave the Kobold area) as there is a very long single-quest chain afterwards

name: Remember Me, Earthen (early leave)
ratingJustification: if you leave before the long single-quest chains, it's super good xp per time, but can still suffer from congestion
notes: This is if you leave the area after the Kobold area

name: All Ore Nothing
ratingJustification: single-quest chains, but the quests are all very easy and there won’t be many issues with congestion here

name: For the Love of Gems
ratingJustification: single-quest chains, not great XP, a bit annoying

name: Opalfront
ratingJustification: lots of travel, but good quests, there may be some congestion issues though

name: Birdman of the Three Shields
ratingJustification: questline is in narnia + the eel quest is AWFUL

name: The Hermit
ratingJustification: very fast quests, minor congestion issues, good xp

name: Lost Lord of the Storm
ratingJustification: super good hub, quests are relatively quick and the 3 rare mob quests are HUGE xp

name: A Titanic Expedition
ratingJustification: quick quests, starting quest is obtained alongside doing another good questline

name: Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood
ratingJustification: the only good thing about this questline is that the quest names are funny

name: How Scandalous!
ratingJustification: extremely fast quests, also unlocks the second half of the chain in The Ringing Deeps later on

name: Delves: The Waterworks (at T3)
ratingJustification: good layout and good monster xp
notes: as with all delves, these are prime congested XP but can be slightly less efficient than speed questing

name: Delves: Dread Pit (at T3)
ratingJustification: overall really nasty layouts with lots of high hp mobs to kill
notes: as with all delves, these are prime congested XP but can be slightly less efficient than speed questing

name: Fearbreaker
ratingJustification: starts off a bit annoying but speeds up and overall good

name: Kobold Work Crew
ratingJustification: fast quests, good xp, 0 travel, though it has a puzzle so if you have 0iq gl

name: Tired of Rest
ratingJustification: lots of single-quest chains that give abhorrent XP

name: Frolicking in the Fetid Grotto
ratingJustification: these quests are fast, downside is that you go out to do the chain and it’s only 3 quests
notes: Recommended to do with Fearbreaker questline

name: Envenomed Vision
ratingJustification: quick quests with a crazy triple quest cluster
notes: Recommended to do with Fearbreaker questline

name: Dread in the Den
ratingJustification: decent XP but annoying quests

name: Revenge in the Rumbling Wastes
ratingJustification: close by, semi-fast quests, but I have a fear that this quest can have issues with launch congestion. If you’re alone here, it could be very good

name: Broken Tools
ratingJustification: very fast quests, only 1 minor congestion issue

name: Abysmal Extraction
startingLocation: southwest of Gundargaz near the elevator
ratingJustification: fast quests, good xp
notes: There's an intro quest SW of Gundargaz, unsure if it's needed or not

name: Into the Fog
ratingJustification: first and last quest is a bit longer, but overall good

name: Rampage at Nibelgaz Mine
ratingJustification: fast and simple quests, main downside is the backtrack in the final quests is a lot of wasted time

name: Magna-nificence
ratingJustification: literally just 4 quests all at once; 3 of which are in the same area, amazing group of quests

name: Striking Steel
ratingJustification: good quests with really good xp, some of the quest objectives can be a bit hard to see, may want to zoom in your minimap

name: Crushing Depths
ratingJustification: quick quests and is located exactly where a campaign already brings you

name: Lights Out
startingLocation: Lorel’s Crossing, which is directly north-east of Mereldar across the chasm
ratingJustification: lots of tightly packed quests that are relatively fast, can potentially be an issue if congested

name: An Orphan’s Request
ratingJustification: very quick, and very good XP quests

name: The Brothers Braunpyke
startingLocation: Mereldar, inside the large chapel at the northern side
ratingJustification: lots of singles, but each quest is very fast and has no major issues with congestion

name: Arcane Trickles
startingLocation: between Mereldar and Tenir’s Ascent / Dawnbreaker dungeon
ratingJustification: the quests are all single, but they’re ALL full xp. the first quest is particularly annoying, though

name: A Mysterious Chef
ratingJustification: single quests, but all fast gathering and simple quests

name: Apart for Purpose
ratingJustification: couple annoying quests, long travel, short, single-quest chain

name: The Weight of Duty
ratingJustification: very quick, very short quests - only downside is that it’s only 3 quests long

name: Suspicious Minds
ratingJustification: quick two quest cluster right at the first 'town' in the campaign, density of quest objectives a bit thin though

name: The Second Front
ratingJustification: pretty quick quests that are in the same area as the campaign, and contributes towards Loremaster chievo

name: The Wormlands
ratingJustification: not the worst quests, should be fine even when congested

name: Haggling with Mmarl
ratingJustification: quick quests and the singles are particularly fast af

name: Silken Ward
ratingJustification: a bunch of single quests, but they’re extremely fast

name: Melody of Madness
ratingJustification: Good XP but these quests are overall really ass compared to the rest of the region, some specific quests are particularly tedious and do not share with other players when clicked.

name: The Wild Camp
ratingJustification: Short, but very fast questline. All quests are talking except for Ancient Respite, so there’s minimal risk of crowding. Can be done as a lower priority questline due to this

name: Pillar-nest Vosh
ratingJustification: fast quests, two doubles, and not far out of the way, super nice

name: Grieve & Weave
ratingJustification: Bad quests, ok xp, short
notes: had weird level flags on beta, if you can't find quests just leave

name: Gutter Work
startingLocation: City of Threads (northeast edge near the water)
ratingJustification: only negative is that it’s in the water

name: Mr. Sunflower’s Therapy
startingLocation: City of Threads (eastern side) (after Into a Skittering City quest)
ratingJustification: Really fast pair of quests that give good XP.

name: Subterfuge in Silk
startingLocation: The Weaver’s Lair (after What We Still Have quest)
ratingJustification: Lots of quests and good xp, but they’re a bit spread out, and some of the quests take a notable amount more time than usual quests.
notes: this questline is a bit spread out, quests won't always be the same area, but they converge after a few quests

name: Bountiful Beetles
ratingJustification: Extremely long single-quest chain where almost all quests are annoying to do.
notes: this unlocks additional world quests, you may want to do it for that reason if rep or wq rewards are good

name: Social Clues
ratingJustification: Decently fast quests, solid XP, but lacks a cluster of quests.
notes: on Beta, the starting quest was a bit SW of where the map marks it

name: Pillar-nest of Horrors
ratingJustification: Recommended to do only if you have a group, as it involves a cave quest with lots of mobs you don’t need, but offers good XP and is semi-quick to complete.
notes: turn on arachnophobia mode, seriously, if you hate spiders this questline is NASTY
